title: SoftBank Finalizing $4 Billion Loan From Apollo-Led Group
sub_head: Deal shows Japanese conglomerate’s need for cash and Apollo’s push into lending
body:
SoftBank Group Corp . is finalizing a $4 billion loan from Apollo Global Management Inc. backed by SoftBank’s stable of technology-startup stakes, money the Japanese conglomerate could use to help weather a downturn in its portfolio and keep up its breakneck pace of investments.
The loan would be secured by SoftBank’s second Vision Fund, people familiar with the matter said. That roughly $40 billion pot includes stakes in 150 companies such as Indian e-commerce giant Flipkart; digital-banking startup Revolut; and Cameo, a site where celebrities sell personalized messages.
